definition: cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]
house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
bridal room and ornamented candles/wedding festivities (idiom)
(of a child bride) to consummate marriage
ritual kneeling to heaven and earth by bride and groom in a old-fashioned wedding ceremony/same as 拜天地
formal exchange of cups of wine between bride and groom as traditional wedding ceremony
to worship heaven and earth/ritual kneeling by bride and groom in a old-fashioned wedding ceremony/also called 拜堂
to share nuptial cup/(fig.) to get married
the pleasure of close intimacy in a couple (idiom)/sexual intercourse
disturbing the privacy of bridal room (Chinese custom where guests banter with and play pranks on the newlyweds)
